text: A titular bishop is a bishop in some churches who does not lead a diocese. A priest who becomes a bishop but does not lead a diocese, such as an auxiliary bishop, a nuncio, or an official in the Roman Curia, is given a titular see. The titular see is a title linked to a diocese that no longer exists. == Related pages == * Archbishop * Archbishop ad personam * Cardinal (Catholic Church) * Bishop coadjutor * Bishop-elect == References == Category:Bishops by type
title: Titular bishop
